data.title: Train From KL To Padang Besar
data.meta_description: How to get from KL to Padang Besar by train? How to get to Thailand from Padang Besar? Read the article and discover how to cross the border with Thailand.
data.text:
Padang Besar – General Information about Destination

Padang Besar is a town located in the northern state of Perlis, Malaysia. The town shares its name with the nearby border checkpoint, which marks the border between Malaysia and Thailand. As a result of its location, Padang Besar serves as a major transportation hub, with a railway station, bus terminal, and taxi stands connecting it to other major cities in Malaysia and Thailand.

The town is also known for its vibrant markets, where visitors can find a wide range of goods, from local produce and traditional handicrafts to electronics and clothing. In addition to its bustling commercial scene, Padang Besar is also a melting pot of diverse cultures, with Malay, Thai, and Chinese influences visible in its food, language, and customs.

Information about the Route (KL Sentral – Padang Besar)

ETS is considered the fastest way to reach the Thai border from Kuala Lumpur. The ETS train route from KL to Padang Besar is operated by Gold (EG) and Platinum (EP) train services. The Platinum train service starts directly from KL Sentral station in Kuala Lumpur and takes around 5 hours and 30 minutes to reach Padang Besar, while the Gold train service starts from Gemas station and takes around 5 hours and 50 minutes, making a stop in Kuala Lumpur at KL Sentral before continuing on to Padang Besar. Ticket prices (harga tiket KL Sentral ke Padang Besar) start from 74 MYR for the Gold train and 100 MYR for the Platinum services.

See also: KTM Butterworth to Padang Besar

Schedule of ETS Train KL Sentral to Padang Besar

(Jadual ETS KL Sentral ke Padang Besar)

The ETS Malaysia train service from KL Sentral to Padang Besar runs five times a day daily, with an occasional sixth service added depending on demand. The first train departs KL Sentral at 07:08 and the last train departs at 22:50.

Departure Point: KL

There are two options for traveling from Kuala Lumpur to Padang Besar, with the main departure point being KL Sentral Station.

KL Sentral Station

KL Sentral is a modern transportation hub that connects major modes of transportation, including trains, buses, taxis, and light rail transit (LRT).

Its centralized location provides easy and convenient access to various parts of the city, as well as intercity and international destinations. Located in the Brickfields area in the southwest of Kuala Lumpur City, KL Sentral is around 3 km away from the city center.

The station is organized into different sections for various rail services, with the ETS located on Level Two of the Transit Concourse, where you can find the ETS Ticket Counter and waiting area. Additionally, the station features a parking lot for visitors and workers in the KL Sentral area, as well as retail and food outlets and a food court.

Kuala Lumpur Station

Kuala Lumpur Station, located at Jalan Sultan Hishamuddin, is the second departure point for travelers journeying from Kuala Lumpur to Padang Besar. The station boasts stunning colonial-style architecture that dates back to the early 1900s.

The station primarily serves KTM Intercity trains, which offer a more affordable option for travel compared to the ETS trains departing from KL Sentral Station.

In addition to the ticket counters and waiting areas, the station also features various facilities such as food outlets, a parking lot, and a convenience store.

See also: ETS train from Padang Besar to KL

Arrival Point: Padang Besar Station

How to Get to Thailand from Padang Besar?

The ETS train to Padang Besar arrives at the KTM Padang Besar train station, located near the border between Malaysia and Thailand. Once you arrive, you have two options to continue your journey to Thailand: take the ThaiRailway (SRT) train from the Padang Besar Malaysia train station, or opt for minivan services available from the train station. On the second floor, you can find many tour companies that can help you with your travel arrangements.

The immigration checkpoint for both Malaysia and Thailand is located within the same building, so you can go through the immigration process at the train station. However, it’s important to note that immigration is only opened shortly before a train is scheduled to depart for Thailand.

If you’re planning to cross into Thailand, it’s important to note that you should avoid taking a train that arrives late at night since all border crossings will be closed.

Alternative – Buses from Kuala Lumpur to Padang Besar

For those planning a trip from Kuala Lumpur to Padang Besar, it’s important to know that there are no direct bus services available for this route. Instead, the train is the only public transportation option for this journey.

About ETS

The ETS (Electric Train Service) is Malaysia’s fastest train service, reaching up to 140 km/h. It runs from Gemas to the Malaysia-Thai border, offering Platinum, Gold, and Silver classes. Platinum is the fastest with the fewest stops, Gold stops more frequently, and Silver is the most affordable with the most stops. Amenities include comfortable seating and air conditioning, with tickets available online and at stations.

Train Facilities

ETS provides a variety of facilities to ensure passengers have a comfortable and enjoyable journey. For those who need a prayer room, a musolla is available in coach C. Passengers can also enjoy food and beverages at the F&B Bistro located in coach C. Luggage rack areas are available in Coach A and F for passengers to store their belongings safely. For elderly and disabled passengers, special seats are provided in coach D, near the unisex OKU-friendly washroom.

Additionally, LCD screens are available at the end of each coach and in the passenger hallway to keep passengers informed about the journey. These facilities are designed to cater to the needs of all passengers and ensure they have a comfortable and convenient journey.
